TopicTitle: [KSP 1.4.5] [x] Science! - KSP Science report and checklist (V5.17)

Articles.Content:
Can we have an option to turn off the "Here and Now" button please.  It's redundant and takes up limited space for other mods, and I don't have any intent to use that feature.

why redundant?

i use it in blizzy's toolbar and so its gone in the applauncher anyway

Either me or this mod is missing something ... ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

Is there a way or could you implement it, to use the "here and now" window to show all available experiments, even if they are 100% complete? I could not find anything in the config files that looked like it would do this for me.

I would like to use this mod as a "science main control station" during flight. Basically avoiding to bind all experiments for every new craft again and again. So, maybe a button on the window - or even just a config option - to not hide run/complete experiments? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Regarding [@Alshain](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/110959-alshain/)'s request: How about a hotkey like Kerbal Engineer uses?

> On 6/5/2017 at 4:43 PM, canisin said:
> 
> 
> I felt curious and took a look at the code ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")
> 
> 
> 
> I present the following change request: [@Z-Key Aerospace](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138926-z-key-aerospace/)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> In file StatusWindow.cs, line 327,
> 
> 
> 
> 
> replace
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     
>     
>     if( _filter.TotalCount - _filter.CompleteCount > 0 )
> 
> 
> 
> 
> with
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     
>     
>     if (_filter.DisplayScienceInstances.Any(x => CanRunExperiment(x)))
> 
> 
> 
> 
> This will mean that warp will be stopped if there are runnable experiments, rather than incomplete experiments!
